person.persName: Theron E. Hall (Worcester County, Massachusetts, manufacturer and soldier)

body.p: Worcester County, Massachusetts manufacturer and soldier. Massachusetts native. Married to Jemima W. Hall. Father of Mary E. Hall, Edmund B. Hall, and Abbie F. Hall. Manufacturer in Worcester County, Massachusetts in 1860. Employed Ellen Marsh as a domestic servant in Worcester County in 1860. Employed Michal Morson as a domestic servant in Worcester County in 1860. Served in 21st Massachusetts Infantry (U.S.A.) as Lieutenant in July 1861. Served in the U.S. Volunteer Quartermaster Department in July 1862, and was later transferred to Camp Nelson, Kentucky, where he was appointed Assistant Quartermaster and also Superintendent of the large numbers of African-American refugees who traveled with enlisting African-American soldiers to Camp Nelson.
